          # After updating this file, run './install.sh' and open a new terminal for the
        
      2. 
      
        
    2. 
          
          
          # changes to take effect.
        
      3.

      4.

          # TODO: we could generate this from the help docs... make the spec central!
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          
          
          _liq() {
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          
          
            # Most of this fuction is setup for various handler functions. The actual dispatch is at the very end.
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          
          
          
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
            # TODO: include 'global-vars.sh' (and maybe break into 'common' and 'runtime'?) once we build this file.
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
            local LIQ_DB_BASENAME=".liq"
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
            local LIQ_DB="${HOME}/${LIQ_DB_BASENAME}"
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
          
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
            local GLOBAL_ACTIONS="help ?"
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
            # Using 'GROUPS' was causing errors; set by some magic.
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
            local ACTION_GROUPS="meta orgs projects work"
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
          
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
            local TOKEN COMP_FUNC CUR OPTS PREV WORK_COUNT TOKEN_COUNT IS_LIQ_ENV
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
            if [[ -n "${COMP_WORDS}" ]]; then
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
              CUR="${COMP_WORDS[COMP_CWORD]}"
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
              PREV="${COMP_WORDS[COMP_CWORD-1]}"
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
            fi
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
            if [[ -n "${COMP_WORDS}" ]]; then
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          
          
              WORD_COUNT=${#COMP_WORDS[@]}
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
            else
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
              WORD_COUND=0
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
            fi
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          
          
          
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
            if [[ "$CUR" == '?' ]]; then
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
              CUR='help'
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
            fi
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
          
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
            no-opts() {
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
              COMPREPLY=( $(compgen -W "" -- ${CUR}) )
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
            }
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
          
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
            std-reply() {
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
              COMPREPLY=( $(compgen -W "${OPTS}" -- ${CUR}) )
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
            }
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
          
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
            proj-paths-reply() {
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
              local MATCH="${1}"
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
          
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
              if [[ "${CUR}" != */* ]]; then
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
                COMPREPLY=( $(compgen -o nospace -W "$(find ~/playground -type d -maxdepth 1 -mindepth 1 -not -name ".*" | awk -F/ '{ print $NF"/" }')" -- ${CUR}) )
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
              else
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
                # TODO: check that 'MATCH' matches /^[a-z0-9-_ *?]$/i
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
                # TODO: source and use LIQ_PLAYGROUND
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          
          
                COMPREPLY=( $(compgen -W "$(ls -d "${HOME}/playground/${CUR}"${MATCH} | awk -F/ '{ print $(NF - 1)"/"$NF }')" -- ${CUR}) )
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
              fi
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
            }
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
          
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
            comp-liq() {
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
              OPTS="${GLOBAL_ACTIONS} ${ACTION_GROUPS}"
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
              [[ "${IS_LIQ_ENV}" == true ]] && OPTS="${OPTS} quit"
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
              std-reply
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
            }
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
          
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
            comp-liq-help() {
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
              OPTS="${ACTION_GROUPS}"; std-reply
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
            }
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
          
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
            comp-func-builder() {
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
              local TOKEN_PATH="${1}"
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
              local VAR_KEY="${2}"
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
              local NO_SQUASH_ACTIONS="${3:-}"
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
              local OPT
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
              local ACTIONS_VAR="${VAR_KEY}_ACTIONS"
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
              local GROUPS_VAR="${VAR_KEY}_GROUPS"
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
              # These functions are dynamic based on the ACTION and GROUP vars so don't need to be overriden; doing so may kill
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
              # custom completion functions. Note that this means that a previously defined function with a new def needs to be
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
              # unset first.
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
              if ! type -t comp-liq-${TOKEN_PATH} | grep -q 'function'; then
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
                # tThe double escape is first for this string, and then when it goes through 'eval'. This way we keep the function
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
                # response dynamic rather than freezing it at the point in time when it's built.
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
                echo "comp-liq-${TOKEN_PATH}() { OPTS=\"\\\${${ACTIONS_VAR}:-} \\\${${GROUPS_VAR}:-}\"; std-reply; }"
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
              fi
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          
          
              if ! type -t comp-liq-help-${TOKEN_PATH} | grep -q 'function'; then
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
                echo "comp-liq-help-${TOKEN_PATH}() { OPTS=\"\\\${${ACTIONS_VAR}:-} \\\${${GROUPS_VAR}:-}\"; std-reply; }"
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
              fi
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
              for OPT in ${!ACTIONS_VAR}; do
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
                if [[ -z "$NO_SQUASH_ACTIONS" ]] || ! type -t comp-liq-${TOKEN_PATH}-${OPT} | grep -q 'function'; then
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
                  echo "function comp-liq-${TOKEN_PATH}-${OPT}() { no-opts; }"
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          
          
                  echo "function comp-liq-help-${TOKEN_PATH}-${OPT}() { no-opts; }"
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
                fi
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          
          
              done
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
            }
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
          
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
            # environments group
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          
          
            local ENVIRONMENTS_ACTIONS="add delete deselect list select set show update"
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          
          
            eval "$(comp-func-builder 'environments' 'ENVIRONMENTS')"
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
          
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          
          
            # meta group
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          
          
            local META_ACTIONS="bash-config init next"
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          
          
            local META_GROUPS="exts"
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          
          
            eval "$(comp-func-builder 'meta' 'META')"
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          
          
          
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          
          
            META_EXTS_ACTIONS="install list uninstall"
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          
          
            eval "$(comp-func-builder 'meta-exts' 'META_EXTS')"
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          
          
            comp-liq-meta-exts-install() {
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          
          
              if [[ "${PREV}" == 'install' ]]; then
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          
          
                COMPREPLY=( $(compgen -W "--local --registry" -- ${CUR}) )
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          
          
              elif [[ "${PREV}" == "--local" ]]; then
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          
          
                proj-paths-reply "*-ext-*"
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          
          
              fi
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
              # Currently no completion for registry packages.
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
            }
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
          
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
            comp-liq-meta-exts-uninstall() {
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          
          
              # TODO: this is essentially the same logic aas 'liq meta exts list'; change completion to use 'rollup-bash' and share code
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
              if [[ -f ${LIQ_DB}/exts/exts.sh ]]; then
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          
          
                COMPREPLY=( $(compgen -W "$(cat "${LIQ_DB}/exts/exts.sh" | awk -F/ 'NF { print $(NF-3)"/"$(NF-2) }')" -- ${CUR}) )
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
              else
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          
          
                return 0
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          
          
              fi
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          
          
            }
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          
          
          
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
            local ORGS_ACTIONS="affiliate create list show select"
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
            local ORGS_GROUPS=""
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          
          
            # will override the 'comp-liq-orgs', but want to generate the 'help' completer
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          
          
            eval "$(comp-func-builder 'orgs' 'ORGS')"
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          
          
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          
          
            # helper funtion for '--org' option values
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
            comp-selector-orgs() {
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          
          
              COMPREPLY=( $(compgen -W "$(find ~/${LIQ_DB_BASENAME}/orgs -maxdepth 1 -mindepth 1 -type l -exec basename {} \;)" -- ${CUR}) )
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          
          
            }
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          
          
          
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          
          
            # Handles generating COMPREPLY when using common orgs parameters. Returns true (0) if COMPREPLY is generated and false
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
            # if the caller still needs to generate COMPREPLY. If COMPREPLY is not set, then this function may update 'OPTS',
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
            # which should be declared locally before invoking comp-builder-ors-common-params. Thus, the general usage is
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          
          
            # something like:
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
            # ```
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          
          
            # local OPTS="--foo --bar"
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          
          
            # comp-builder-orgs-common-params || std-reply
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          
          
            # ```
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
            comp-builder-orgs-common-params() {
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          
          
              if [[ "${PREV}" == "--org" ]]; then
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          
          
                comp-selector-orgs
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          
          
                return 0 # bash true; meaning "the COMPREPLY has been handled"
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          
          
              else
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          
          
                if [[ "${COMP_LINE}" != *--org* ]]; then
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          
          
                  if [[ -z "${OPTS}" ]]; then OPTS="--org"; else OPTS="${OPTS} --org"; fi
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          
          
                fi
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          
          
                return 1 # bash false; mening "the COMPREPLY has not been handled"
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          
          
              fi
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          
          
            }
        
      145. 
      
        
    145. 
          
          
          
        
      146. 
      
        
    146. 
          
          
            local PROJECTS_ACTIONS="build close create edit publish qa sync test"
        
      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          
          
            local PROJECTS_GROUPS=""
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          
          
            eval "$(comp-func-builder 'projects' 'PROJECTS')"
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          
          
            comp-liq-projects-create() {
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          
          
              if [[ "${PREV}" == "create" ]]; then
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          
          
                COMPREPLY=( $(compgen -W "--new --source" -- ${CUR}) )
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          
          
              elif [[ "${PREV}" == "--new" ]] || [[ "${PREV}" == "-n" ]]; then
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          
          
                COMPREPLY=( $(compgen -W "raw" -- ${CUR}) )
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          
          
              fi
        
      155. 
      
        
    155. 
          
          
            }
        
      156. 
      
        
    156. 
          
          
            comp-liq-projects-close() {
        
      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          
          
          
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          
          
              if [[ "${COMP_LINE}" != *'/'? ]]; then
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          
          
                proj-paths-reply '*'
        
      160. 
      
        
    160. 
          
          
              fi
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          
          
            }
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          
          
          
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          
          
            local WORK_ACTIONS="diff-master edit ignore-rest involve list merge qa report resume save stage start status stop submit sync"
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          
          
            local WORK_GROUPS="issues links"
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          
          
            eval "$(comp-func-builder 'work' 'WORK')"
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          
          
            comp-liq-work-stage() {
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          
          
              # TODO: 'nospace' is very unfortunately innefective (on MacOS 10.x AFAIK)
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          
          
              COMPREPLY=( $(compgen -o nospace -W "$(for d in ${CUR}*; do [[ -d "$d" ]] && echo "$d/" || echo "$d"; done)" -- ${CUR}) )
        
      169. 
      
        
    169. 
          
          
            }
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          
          
          
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          
          
            local WORK_ISSUES_ACTIONS="--add --list --remove"
        
      172. 
      
        
    172. 
          
          
            eval "$(comp-func-builder 'work-issues' 'WORK_ISSUES')"
        
      173. 
      
        
    173. 
          
          
          
        
      174. 
      
        
    174. 
          
          
            local WORK_LINKS_ACTIONS="add list remove"
        
      175. 
      
        
    175. 
          
          
            eval "$(comp-func-builder 'work-links' 'WORK_LINKS')"
        
      176. 
      
        
    176. 
          
          
            comp-liq-work-links-remove() {
        
      177. 
      
        
    177. 
          
          
              OPTS="$(yalc check || true)"
        
      178. 
      
        
    178. 
          
          
              # TODO: code adapated from 'work-links-list'; once we build completion, let's share
        
      179. 
      
        
    179. 
          
          
              OPTS="$(echo "$OPTS" | awk -F: '{print $2}' | tr "'" '"' | jq -r '.[]')"
        
      180. 
      
        
    180. 
          
          
              std-reply
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          
          
            }
        
      182. 
      
        
    182. 
          
          
            comp-liq-work-status() {
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          
          
              local EX_OPTS="--list-projects --list-issues --pr-ready"
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          
          
              local COMMON_OPTS="--no-fetch"
        
      185. 
      
        
    185. 
          
          
          
        
      186. 
      
        
    186. 
          
          
              local i
        
      187. 
      
        
    187. 
          
          
              for i in $COMMON_OPTS; do
        
      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          
          
                [[ $COMP_LINE != *" ${i}"* ]]  && OPTS="${i} ${OPTS}"
        
      189. 
      
        
    189. 
          
          
              done
        
      190. 
      
        
    190. 
          
          
          
        
      191. 
      
        
    191. 
          
          
              local EXES=false
        
      192. 
      
        
    192. 
          
          
              for i in $EX_OPTS; do
        
      193. 
      
        
    193. 
          
          
                if [[ $COMP_LINE == *" ${i}"* ]]; then EXES=true; break; fi
        
      194. 
      
        
    194. 
          
          
              done
        
      195. 
      
        
    195. 
          
          
              [[ "${EXES}" == 'false' ]] && OPTS="${EX_OPTS} ${OPTS}"
        
      196. 
      
        
    196. 
          
          
          
        
      197. 
      
        
    197. 
          
          
              # have they specified work?
        
      198. 
      
        
    198. 
          
          
              local AFTER
        
      199. 
      
        
    199. 
          
          
              AFTER="${COMP_LINE/* status/}"
        
      200. 
      
        
    200. 
          
          
              AFTER="${AFTER%$CUR}"
        
      201. 
      
        
    201. 
          
          
          
        
      202. 
      
        
    202. 
          
          
              if [[ "${PREV}" == 'status' ]] || ! { echo "${AFTER}" | grep -qE '(^| )[a-zA-Z0-9][a-zA-Z0-9_.-]*( |$)'; }; then
        
      203. 
      
        
    203. 
          
          
                OPTS="${OPTS} $(find "${LIQ_DB}/work" -type f -maxdepth 1 -exec basename {} \;)"
        
      204. 
      
        
    204. 
          
          
              fi
        
      205. 
      
        
    205. 
          
          
          
        
      206. 
      
        
    206. 
          
          
              std-reply
        
      207. 
      
        
    207. 
          
          
            }
        
      208. 
      
        
    208. 
          
          
          
        
      209. 
      
        
    209. 
          
          
            # TODO: Should we use LIQ_EXTS_DB here? This way, we're sidestepping the need to 'build' the completion script...
        
      210. 
      
        
    210. 
          
          
            source "${LIQ_DB}/exts/comps.sh"
        
      211. 
      
        
    211. 
          
          
          
        
      212. 
      
        
    212. 
          
          
            TOKEN_COUNT=0
        
      213. 
      
        
    213. 
          
          
            if [[ "${COMP_LINE}" != 'liq '* ]]; then # we are in the 'shell' case, which omits the leading 'liq'
        
      214. 
      
        
    214. 
          
          
              COMP_FUNC='comp-liq'
        
      215. 
      
        
    215. 
          
          
              IS_LIQ_ENV=true
        
      216. 
      
        
    216. 
          
          
            else
        
      217. 
      
        
    217. 
          
          
              COMP_FUNC='comp'
        
      218. 
      
        
    218. 
          
          
              IS_LIQ_ENV=false
        
      219. 
      
        
    219. 
          
          
            fi
        
      220. 
      
        
    220. 
          
          
          
        
      221. 
      
        
    221. 
          
          
            # Now we've registered all the local and modular completion functions. We'll analyze the token stream to figure out
        
      222. 
      
        
    222. 
          
          
            # which completion function to call:
        
      223. 
      
        
    223. 
          
          
            [[ -n "${COMP_WORDS}" ]] && for TOKEN in ${COMP_WORDS[@]}; do
        
      224. 
      
        
    224. 
          
          
              if [[ "$TOKEN" != -* ]] && { (( $TOKEN_COUNT + 1 < $WORD_COUNT )) || [[ "${TOKEN}" == 'liq' ]]; }; then
        
      225. 
      
        
    225. 
          
          
                if [[ "$(type -t "${COMP_FUNC}-${TOKEN}")" == 'function' ]]; then
        
      226. 
      
        
    226. 
          
          
                  COMP_FUNC="${COMP_FUNC}-${TOKEN}"
        
      227. 
      
        
    227. 
          
          
                  TOKEN_COUNT=$(( $TOKEN_COUNT + 1 ))
        
      228. 
      
        
    228. 
          
          
                fi
        
      229. 
      
        
    229. 
          
          
              else
        
      230. 
      
        
    230. 
          
          
                TOKEN_COUNT=$(( $TOKEN_COUNT + 1 ))
        
      231. 
      
        
    231. 
          
          
              fi
        
      232. 
      
        
    232. 
          
          
            done
        
      233. 
      
        
    233. 
          
          
          
        
      234. 
      
        
    234. 
          
          
            # Execute the compeltion function determined above:
        
      235. 
      
        
    235. 
          
          
            $COMP_FUNC
        
      236. 
      
        
    236. 
          
          
            return 0
        
      237. 
      
        
    237. 
          
          
          }
        
      238. 
      
        
    238. 
          
          
          
        
      239. 
      
        
    239. 
          
          
          complete -F _liq liq
        
      240. 
      
        
    240. 
          
          
          # complete -F _liq
        
      241.

    install.sh

    0.0 % covered

    517 relevant lines. 0 lines covered and 517 lines missed.

          reset=`tput sgr0`

          list-add-item() {
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
            local LIST_VAR="${1}"; shift
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
            while (( $# > 0 )); do
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
              local ITEM
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
              ITEM="${1}"; shift
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
              # TODO: enforce no newlines in item
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
          
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
              if [[ -n "$ITEM" ]]; then
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          
          
                if [[ -z "${!LIST_VAR:-}" ]]; then
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
                  eval $LIST_VAR='"$ITEM"'
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
                else
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
                  # echo $LIST_VAR='"${!LIST_VAR}"$'"'"'\n'"'"'"${ITEM}"'
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
                  eval $LIST_VAR='"${!LIST_VAR}"$'"'"'\n'"'"'"${ITEM}"'
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
                fi
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
              fi
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
            done
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
          }
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
          
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
          list-add-uniq() {
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
            local LIST_VAR="${1}"; shift
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
            while (( $# > 0 )); do
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
              local ITEM
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
              ITEM="${1}"; shift
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
              # TODO: enforce no newlines in item
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
              if [[ -z $(list-get-index $LIST_VAR "$ITEM") ]]; then
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
                list-add-item $LIST_VAR "$ITEM"
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
              fi
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
            done
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
          }
        
      68.

      69.

          # Echos the number of items in the list.
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
          #
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
          # Takes single argument, the list var name.
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
          #
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
          # Example:
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
          # list-add-item A B C
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
          # list-count MY_LIST # echos '3'
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          
          
          list-count() {
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
            if [[ -z "${!1:-}" ]]; then
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
              echo -n "0"
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
            else
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
              echo -e "${!1}" | wc -l | tr -d '[:space:]'
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
            fi
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          
          
          }
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
          
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          
          
          list-from-csv() {
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
            local LIST_VAR="${1}"
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
            local CSV="${2:-}"
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
          
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          
          
            if [[ -z "$CSV" ]]; then
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          
          
              CSV="${!LIST_VAR}"
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
              unset ${LIST_VAR}
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          
          
            fi
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          
          
          
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          
          
            if [[ -n "$CSV" ]]; then
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          
          
              local ADDR
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          
          
              while IFS=',' read -ra ADDR; do
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          
          
                for i in "${ADDR[@]}"; do
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          
          
                  i="$(echo "$i" | awk '{$1=$1};1')"
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          
          
                  list-add-item "$LIST_VAR" "$i"
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          
          
                done
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          
          
              done <<< "$CSV"
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          
          
            fi
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          
          
          }
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          
          
          
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
          list-get-index() {
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
            local LIST_VAR="${1}"
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
            local TEST="${2}"
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
          
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          
          
            local ITEM
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
            local INDEX=0
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          
          
            while read -r ITEM; do
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
              if [[ "${ITEM}" == "${TEST}" ]]; then
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          
          
                echo $INDEX
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          
          
                return
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          
          
              fi
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          
          
              INDEX=$(($INDEX + 1))
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
            done <<< "${!LIST_VAR:-}"
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
          }
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          
          
          
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          
          
          list-get-item() {
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          
            local LIST_VAR="${1}"
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          
          
            local INDEX="${2}"
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
          
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          
          
            local CURR_INDEX=0
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          
          
            local ITEM
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          
          
            while read -r ITEM; do
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          
          
              if (( $CURR_INDEX == $INDEX )) ; then
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
                echo -n "${ITEM%\\n}"
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
                return
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          
          
              fi
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
              CURR_INDEX=$(($CURR_INDEX + 1))
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          
          
            done <<< "${!LIST_VAR}"
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          
          
          }
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          
          
          
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
          # Echoes the frist item in the named list matching the given prefix.
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          
          
          #
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          
          
          # Example:
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          
          
          # LIST="foo bar"$'\n'"foo baz"
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          
          
          # list-get-item-by-prefix LIST "foo " # echoes 'foo bar'
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          
          
          list-get-item-by-prefix() {
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          
          
            local LIST_VAR="${1}"
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          
          
            local PREFIX="${2}"
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          
          
          
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          
          
            local ITEM
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          
          
            while read -r ITEM; do
        
      145. 
      
        
    145. 
          
          
              if [[ "${ITEM}" == "${PREFIX}"* ]] ; then
        
      146. 
      
        
    146. 
          
          
                echo -n "${ITEM%\\n}"
        
      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          
          
                return
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          
          
              fi
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          
          
            done <<< "${!LIST_VAR}"
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          
          
          }
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          
          
          
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          
          
          # Joins a list with a given string and echos the result. We use 'echo -e' for the join string, so '\n', '\t', etc. will
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          
          
          # work.
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          
          
          #
        
      155. 
      
        
    155. 
          
          
          # Takes (1) the list variable name, (2) the join string
        
      156. 
      
        
    156. 
          
          
          #
        
      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          
          
          # Example:
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          
          
          # list-add-item MY_LIST A B C
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          
          
          # list-join MY_LIST '||' # echos 'A||B||C'
        
      160. 
      
        
    160. 
          
          
          list-join() {
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          
          
            local LIST_VAR="${1}"
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          
          
            local JOIN_STRING="${2}"
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          
          
          
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          
          
            local CURR_INDEX=0
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          
          
            local COUNT
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          
          
            COUNT="$(list-count $LIST_VAR)"
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          
          
            while read -r ITEM; do
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          
          
              echo -n "$ITEM"
        
      169. 
      
        
    169. 
          
          
              CURR_INDEX=$(($CURR_INDEX + 1))
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          
          
              if (( $CURR_INDEX < $COUNT )) ; then
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          
          
                echo -ne "$JOIN_STRING"
        
      172. 
      
        
    172. 
          
          
              fi
        
      173. 
      
        
    173. 
          
          
            done <<< "${!LIST_VAR}"
        
      174. 
      
        
    174. 
          
          
          }
        
      175. 
      
        
    175. 
          
          
          
        
      176. 
      
        
    176. 
          
          
          list-replace-by-string() {
        
      177. 
      
        
    177. 
          
          
            local LIST_VAR="${1}"
        
      178. 
      
        
    178. 
          
          
            local TEST_ITEM="${2}"
        
      179. 
      
        
    179. 
          
          
            local NEW_ITEM="${3}"
        
      180. 
      
        
    180. 
          
          
          
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          
          
            local ITEM INDEX NEW_LIST
        
      182. 
      
        
    182. 
          
          
            INDEX=0
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          
          
            for ITEM in ${!LIST_VAR:-}; do
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          
          
              if [[ "$(list-get-item $LIST_VAR $INDEX)" == "$TEST_ITEM" ]]; then
        
      185. 
      
        
    185. 
          
          
                list-add-item NEW_LIST "$NEW_ITEM"
        
      186. 
      
        
    186. 
          
          
              else
        
      187. 
      
        
    187. 
          
          
                list-add-item NEW_LIST "$ITEM"
        
      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          
          
              fi
        
      189. 
      
        
    189. 
          
          
              INDEX=$(($INDEX + 1))
        
      190. 
      
        
    190. 
          
          
            done
        
      191. 
      
        
    191. 
          
          
            eval $LIST_VAR='"'"$NEW_LIST"'"'
        
      192. 
      
        
    192. 
          
          
          }
        
      193. 
      
        
    193. 
          
          
          
        
      194. 
      
        
    194. 
          
          
          list-quote() {
        
      195. 
      
        
    195. 
          
          
            local LIST_VAR="${1}"
        
      196. 
      
        
    196. 
          
          
          
        
      197. 
      
        
    197. 
          
          
            while read -r ITEM; do
        
      198. 
      
        
    198. 
          
          
              echo -n "'$(echo "$ITEM" | sed -e "s/'/'\"'\"'/")' "
        
      199. 
      
        
    199. 
          
          
            done <<< "${!LIST_VAR:-}"
        
      200. 
      
        
    200. 
          
          
          }
        
      201. 
      
        
    201. 
          
          
          
        
      202. 
      
        
    202. 
          
          
          list-rm-item() {
        
      203. 
      
        
    203. 
          
          
            local LIST_VAR="${1}"; shift
        
      204. 
      
        
    204. 
          
          
            while (( $# > 0 )); do
        
      205. 
      
        
    205. 
          
          
              local ITEM NEW_ITEMS
        
      206. 
      
        
    206. 
          
          
              ITEM="${1}"; shift
        
      207. 
      
        
    207. 
          
          
              ITEM=${ITEM//\/\\/}
        
      208. 
      
        
    208. 
          
          
              ITEM=${ITEM//#/\\#}
        
      209. 
      
        
    209. 
          
          
              ITEM=${ITEM//./\\.}
        
      210. 
      
        
    210. 
          
          
              ITEM=${ITEM//[/\\[}
        
      211. 
      
        
    211. 
          
          
              # echo "ITEM: $ITEM" >&2
        
      212. 
      
        
    212. 
          
          
              NEW_ITEMS="$(echo "${!LIST_VAR}" | sed -e '\#^'"${ITEM}"'$#d')"
        
      213. 
      
        
    213. 
          
          
              eval $LIST_VAR='"'"$NEW_ITEMS"'"'
        
      214. 
      
        
    214. 
          
          
            done
        
      215. 
      
        
    215. 
          
          
          }
        
      216. 
      
        
    216. 
          
          
          
        
      217. 
      
        
    217. 
          
          
          if [[ $(uname) == 'Darwin' ]]; then
        
      218. 
      
        
    218. 
          
          
            GNU_GETOPT="$(brew --prefix gnu-getopt)/bin/getopt"
        
      219. 
      
        
    219. 
          
          
          else
        
      220. 
      
        
    220. 
          
          
            GNU_GETOPT="$(which getopt)"
        
      221. 
      
        
    221. 
          
          
          fi
        
      222. 
      
        
    222. 
          
          
          
        
      223. 
      
        
    223. 
          
          
          # Usage:
        
      224. 
      
        
    224. 
          
          
          #   eval "$(setSimpleOptions SHORT LONG= SPECIFY_SHORT:X LONG_SPEC:S= -- "$@")" \
        
      225. 
      
        
    225. 
          
          
          #     || ( contextHelp; echoerrandexit "Bad options."; )
        
      226. 
      
        
    226. 
          
          
          #
        
      227. 
      
        
    227. 
          
          
          # Note the use of the intermediate TMP is important to preserve the exit value
        
      228. 
      
        
    228. 
          
          
          # setSimpleOptions. E.g., doing 'eval "$(setSimpleOptions ...)"' will work fine,
        
      229. 
      
        
    229. 
          
          
          # but because the last statement is the eval of the results, and not the function
        
      230. 
      
        
    230. 
          
          
          # call itself, the return of setSimpleOptions gets lost.
        
      231. 
      
        
    231. 
          
          
          #
        
      232. 
      
        
    232. 
          
          
          # Instead, it's generally recommended to be strict, 'set -e', and use the TMP-form.
        
      233. 
      
        
    233. 
          
          
          setSimpleOptions() {
        
      234. 
      
        
    234. 
          
          
            local VAR_SPEC LOCAL_DECLS
        
      235. 
      
        
    235. 
          
          
            local LONG_OPTS=""
        
      236. 
      
        
    236. 
          
          
            local SHORT_OPTS=""
        
      237. 
      
        
    237. 
          
          
            # Bash Bug? This looks like a straight up bug in bash, but the left-paren in
        
      238. 
      
        
    238. 
          
          
            # '--)' was matching the '$(' and causing a syntax error. So we use ']' and
        
      239. 
      
        
    239. 
          
          
            # replace it later.
        
      240. 
      
        
    240. 
          
          
            local CASE_HANDLER=$(cat <<EOF
        
      241. 
      
        
    241. 
          
          
              --]
        
      242. 
      
        
    242. 
          
          
                break;;
        
      243. 
      
        
    243. 
          
          
          EOF
        
      244. 
      
        
    244. 
          
          
          )
        
      245. 
      
        
    245. 
          
          
            while true; do
        
      246. 
      
        
    246. 
          
          
              if (( $# == 0 )); then
        
      247. 
      
        
    247. 
          
          
                echoerrandexit "setSimpleOptions: No argument to process; did you forget to include the '--' marker?"
        
      248. 
      
        
    248. 
          
          
              fi
        
      249. 
      
        
    249. 
          
          
              VAR_SPEC="$1"; shift
        
      250. 
      
        
    250. 
          
          
              local VAR_NAME LOWER_NAME SHORT_OPT LONG_OPT IS_PASSTHRU
        
      251. 
      
        
    251. 
          
          
              IS_PASSTHRU=''
        
      252. 
      
        
    252. 
          
          
              if [[ "$VAR_SPEC" == *'^' ]]; then
        
      253. 
      
        
    253. 
          
          
                IS_PASSTHRU=true
        
      254. 
      
        
    254. 
          
          
                VAR_SPEC=${VAR_SPEC/%^/}
        
      255. 
      
        
    255. 
          
          
              fi
        
      256. 
      
        
    256. 
          
          
              local OPT_ARG=''
        
      257. 
      
        
    257. 
          
          
              if [[ "$VAR_SPEC" == *'=' ]]; then
        
      258. 
      
        
    258. 
          
          
                OPT_ARG=':'
        
      259. 
      
        
    259. 
          
          
                VAR_SPEC=${VAR_SPEC/%=/}
        
      260. 
      
        
    260. 
          
          
              fi
        
      261. 
      
        
    261. 
          
          
          
        
      262. 
      
        
    262. 
          
          
              if [[ "$VAR_SPEC" == '--' ]]; then
        
      263. 
      
        
    263. 
          
          
                break
        
      264. 
      
        
    264. 
          
          
              elif [[ "$VAR_SPEC" == *':'* ]]; then
        
      265. 
      
        
    265. 
          
          
                VAR_NAME=$(echo "$VAR_SPEC" | cut -d: -f1)
        
      266. 
      
        
    266. 
          
          
                SHORT_OPT=$(echo "$VAR_SPEC" | cut -d: -f2)
        
      267. 
      
        
    267. 
          
          
              else # each input is a variable name
        
      268. 
      
        
    268. 
          
          
                VAR_NAME="$VAR_SPEC"
        
      269. 
      
        
    269. 
          
          
                SHORT_OPT=$(echo "${VAR_NAME::1}" | tr '[:upper:]' '[:lower:]')
        
      270. 
      
        
    270. 
          
          
              fi
        
      271. 
      
        
    271. 
          
          
          
        
      272. 
      
        
    272. 
          
          
              VAR_NAME=$(echo "$VAR_NAME" | tr -d "=")
        
      273. 
      
        
    273. 
          
          
              LOWER_NAME=$(echo "$VAR_NAME" | tr '[:upper:]' '[:lower:]')
        
      274. 
      
        
    274. 
          
          
              LONG_OPT="$(echo "${LOWER_NAME}" | tr '_' '-')"
        
      275. 
      
        
    275. 
          
          
          
        
      276. 
      
        
    276. 
          
          
              if [[ -n "${SHORT_OPT}" ]]; then
        
      277. 
      
        
    277. 
          
          
                SHORT_OPTS="${SHORT_OPTS:-}${SHORT_OPT}${OPT_ARG}"
        
      278. 
      
        
    278. 
          
          
              fi
        
      279. 
      
        
    279. 
          
          
          
        
      280. 
      
        
    280. 
          
          
              LONG_OPTS=$( ( test ${#LONG_OPTS} -gt 0 && echo -n "${LONG_OPTS},") || true && echo -n "${LONG_OPT}${OPT_ARG}")
        
      281. 
      
        
    281. 
          
          
          
        
      282. 
      
        
    282. 
          
          
              LOCAL_DECLS="${LOCAL_DECLS:-}local ${VAR_NAME}='';"
        
      283. 
      
        
    283. 
          
          
              local CASE_SELECT="-${SHORT_OPT}|--${LONG_OPT}]"
        
      284. 
      
        
    284. 
          
          
              if [[ "$IS_PASSTHRU" == true ]]; then # handle passthru
        
      285. 
      
        
    285. 
          
          
                CASE_HANDLER=$(cat <<EOF
        
      286. 
      
        
    286. 
          
          
                  ${CASE_HANDLER}
        
      287. 
      
        
    287. 
          
          
                    ${CASE_SELECT}
        
      288. 
      
        
    288. 
          
          
                    list-add-item _PASSTHRU "\$1"
        
      289. 
      
        
    289. 
          
          
          EOF
        
      290. 
      
        
    290. 
          
          
                )
        
      291. 
      
        
    291. 
          
          
                if [[ -n "$OPT_ARG" ]]; then
        
      292. 
      
        
    292. 
          
          
                  CASE_HANDLER=$(cat <<EOF
        
      293. 
      
        
    293. 
          
          
                    ${CASE_HANDLER}
        
      294. 
      
        
    294. 
          
          
                      list-add-item _PASSTHRU "\$2"
        
      295. 
      
        
    295. 
          
          
                      shift
        
      296. 
      
        
    296. 
          
          
          EOF
        
      297. 
      
        
    297. 
          
          
                  )
        
      298. 
      
        
    298. 
          
          
                fi
        
      299. 
      
        
    299. 
          
          
                CASE_HANDLER=$(cat <<EOF
        
      300. 
      
        
    300. 
          
          
                  ${CASE_HANDLER}
        
      301. 
      
        
    301. 
          
          
                    shift;;
        
      302. 
      
        
    302. 
          
          
          EOF
        
      303. 
      
        
    303. 
          
          
                )
        
      304. 
      
        
    304. 
          
          
              else # non-passthru vars
        
      305. 
      
        
    305. 
          
          
                local VAR_SETTER="${VAR_NAME}=true;"
        
      306. 
      
        
    306. 
          
          
                if [[ -n "$OPT_ARG" ]]; then
        
      307. 
      
        
    307. 
          
          
                  LOCAL_DECLS="${LOCAL_DECLS}local ${VAR_NAME}_SET='';"
        
      308. 
      
        
    308. 
          
          
                  VAR_SETTER=${VAR_NAME}'="${2}"; '${VAR_NAME}'_SET=true; shift;'
        
      309. 
      
        
    309. 
          
          
                fi
        
      310. 
      
        
    310. 
          
          
                if [[ -z "$SHORT_OPT" ]]; then
        
      311. 
      
        
    311. 
          
          
                  CASE_SELECT="--${LONG_OPT}]"
        
      312. 
      
        
    312. 
          
          
                fi
        
      313. 
      
        
    313. 
          
          
                CASE_HANDLER=$(cat <<EOF
        
      314. 
      
        
    314. 
          
          
                ${CASE_HANDLER}
        
      315. 
      
        
    315. 
          
          
                  ${CASE_SELECT}
        
      316. 
      
        
    316. 
          
          
                    $VAR_SETTER
        
      317. 
      
        
    317. 
          
          
                    _OPTS_COUNT=\$(( \$_OPTS_COUNT + 1))
        
      318. 
      
        
    318. 
          
          
                    shift;;
        
      319. 
      
        
    319. 
          
          
          EOF
        
      320. 
      
        
    320. 
          
          
                )
        
      321. 
      
        
    321. 
          
          
              fi
        
      322. 
      
        
    322. 
          
          
            done # main while loop
        
      323. 
      
        
    323. 
          
          
            CASE_HANDLER=$(cat <<EOF
        
      324. 
      
        
    324. 
          
          
              case "\${1}" in
        
      325. 
      
        
    325. 
          
          
                $CASE_HANDLER
        
      326. 
      
        
    326. 
          
          
              esac
        
      327. 
      
        
    327. 
          
          
          EOF
        
      328. 
      
        
    328. 
          
          
          )
        
      329. 
      
        
    329. 
          
          
            # replace the ']'; see 'Bash Bug?' above
        
      330. 
      
        
    330. 
          
          
            CASE_HANDLER=$(echo "$CASE_HANDLER" | perl -pe 's/\]$/)/')
        
      331. 
      
        
    331. 
          
          
          
        
      332. 
      
        
    332. 
          
          
            echo "$LOCAL_DECLS"
        
      333. 
      
        
    333. 
          
          
          
        
      334. 
      
        
    334. 
          
          
            cat <<EOF
        
      335. 
      
        
    335. 
          
          
          local TMP # see https://unix.stackexchange.com/a/88338/84520
        
      336. 
      
        
    336. 
          
          
          local _PASSTHRU=""
        
      337. 
      
        
    337. 
          
          
          TMP=\$(${GNU_GETOPT} -o "${SHORT_OPTS}" -l "${LONG_OPTS}" -- "\$@") \
        
      338. 
      
        
    338. 
          
          
            || exit \$?
        
      339. 
      
        
    339. 
          
          
          eval set -- "\$TMP"
        
      340. 
      
        
    340. 
          
          
          local _OPTS_COUNT=0
        
      341. 
      
        
    341. 
          
          
          while true; do
        
      342. 
      
        
    342. 
          
          
            $CASE_HANDLER
        
      343. 
      
        
    343. 
          
          
          done
        
      344. 
      
        
    344. 
          
          
          shift
        
      345. 
      
        
    345. 
          
          
          if [[ -n "\$_PASSTHRU" ]]; then
        
      346. 
      
        
    346. 
          
          
            eval set -- \$(list-quote _PASSTHRU) "\$@"
        
      347. 
      
        
    347. 
          
          
          fi
        
      348. 
      
        
    348. 
          
          
          EOF
        
      349. 
      
        
    349. 
          
          
          }
        
      350. 
      
        
    350. 
          
          
          
        
      351. 
      
        
    351. 
          
          
          echoerr() {
        
      352. 
      
        
    352. 
          
          
            local TMP
        
      353. 
      
        
    353. 
          
          
            TMP=$(setSimpleOptions NO_FOLD:F -- "$@")
        
      354. 
      
        
    354. 
          
          
            eval "$TMP"
        
      355. 
      
        
    355. 
          
          
          
        
      356. 
      
        
    356. 
          
          
            if [[ -z "$NO_FOLD" ]]; then
        
      357. 
      
        
    357. 
          
          
              echo -e "${red}$*${reset}" | fold -sw 82 >&2
        
      358. 
      
        
    358. 
          
          
            else
        
      359. 
      
        
    359. 
          
          
              echo -e "${red}$*${reset}"
        
      360. 
      
        
    360. 
          
          
            fi
        
      361. 
      
        
    361. 
          
          
          }
        
      362. 
      
        
    362. 
          
          
          
        
      363. 
      
        
    363. 
          
          
          echowarn() {
        
      364. 
      
        
    364. 
          
          
            local TMP
        
      365. 
      
        
    365. 
          
          
            TMP=$(setSimpleOptions NO_FOLD:F -- "$@")
        
      366. 
      
        
    366. 
          
          
            eval "$TMP"
        
      367. 
      
        
    367. 
          
          
          
        
      368. 
      
        
    368. 
          
          
            if [[ -z "$NO_FOLD" ]]; then
        
      369. 
      
        
    369. 
          
          
              echo -e "${yellow}$*${reset}" | fold -sw 82 >&2
        
      370. 
      
        
    370. 
          
          
            else
        
      371. 
      
        
    371. 
          
          
              echo -e "${yellow}$*${reset}"
        
      372. 
      
        
    372. 
          
          
            fi
        
      373. 
      
        
    373. 
          
          
          }
        
      374. 
      
        
    374. 
          
          
          
        
      375. 
      
        
    375. 
          
          
          echoerrandexit() {
        
      376. 
      
        
    376. 
          
          
            local TMP
        
      377. 
      
        
    377. 
          
          
            TMP=$(setSimpleOptions NO_FOLD:F -- "$@") || $(echo "Bad options: $*"; exit -10)
        
      378. 
      
        
    378. 
          
          
            eval "$TMP"
        
      379. 
      
        
    379. 
          
          
          
        
      380. 
      
        
    380. 
          
          
            local MSG="$1"
        
      381. 
      
        
    381. 
          
          
            local EXIT_CODE="${2:-10}"
        
      382. 
      
        
    382. 
          
          
            # TODO: consider providing 'passopts' method which coordites with 'setSimpleOptions' to recreate option string
        
      383. 
      
        
    383. 
          
          
            if [[ -n "$NO_FOLD" ]]; then
        
      384. 
      
        
    384. 
          
          
              echoerr --no-fold "$MSG"
        
      385. 
      
        
    385. 
          
          
            else
        
      386. 
      
        
    386. 
          
          
              echoerr "$MSG"
        
      387. 
      
        
    387. 
          
          
            fi
        
      388. 
      
        
    388. 
          
          
            exit $EXIT_CODE
        
      389. 
      
        
    389. 
          
          
          }
        
      390. 
      
        
    390. 
          
          
          
        
      391. 
      
        
    391. 
          
          
          echo "Starting liq install..."
        
      392. 
      
        
    392. 
          
          
          
        
      393. 
      
        
    393. 
          
          
          # TODO: move to bash-toolkit
        
      394. 
      
        
    394. 
          
          
          
        
      395. 
      
        
    395. 
          
          
          # Prints line with any standard format. First arg is the format name, everything else, along with any options, are
        
      396. 
      
        
    396. 
          
          
          # passed through to echo.
        
      397. 
      
        
    397. 
          
          
          echofmt() {
        
      398. 
      
        
    398. 
          
          
            eval "$(setSimpleOptions NO_NEWLINE -- "$@")"
        
      399. 
      
        
    399. 
          
          
            local COLOR="${1}"; shift
        
      400. 
      
        
    400. 
          
          
            [[ -n "${!COLOR}" ]]
        
      401. 
      
        
    401. 
          
          
            OPTS="-e"
        
      402. 
      
        
    402. 
          
          
            if [[ -n "$NO_NEWLINE" ]]; then OPTS="$OPTS -n"; fi
        
      403. 
      
        
    403. 
          
          
            echo ${OPTS} "${!COLOR}$*${reset}" | fold -sw 82
        
      404. 
      
        
    404. 
          
          
          }
        
      405. 
      
        
    405. 
          
          
          
        
      406. 
      
        
    406. 
          
          
          # Prints the line in green. Any options are passed through to echo.
        
      407. 
      
        
    407. 
          
          
          echogreen() {
        
      408. 
      
        
    408. 
          
          
            echofmt green "$@"
        
      409. 
      
        
    409. 
          
          
          }
        
      410. 
      
        
    410. 
          
          
          
        
      411. 
      
        
    411. 
          
          
          # Basic indent of a line.
        
      412. 
      
        
    412. 
          
          
          indent() {
        
      413. 
      
        
    413. 
          
          
            cat | sed -e 's/^/  /'
        
      414. 
      
        
    414. 
          
          
          }
        
      415. 
      
        
    415. 
          
          
          
        
      416. 
      
        
    416. 
          
          
          # Folds the summary with a hanging indent.
        
      417. 
      
        
    417. 
          
          
          _help-func-summary() {
        
      418. 
      
        
    418. 
          
          
            local FUNC_NAME="${1}"
        
      419. 
      
        
    419. 
          
          
            local OPTIONS="${2:-}"
        
      420. 
      
        
    420. 
          
          
          
        
      421. 
      
        
    421. 
          
          
            local STD_FOLD=82
        
      422. 
      
        
    422. 
          
          
            local WIDTH
        
      423. 
      
        
    423. 
          
          
            WIDTH=$(( $STD_FOLD - 2 ))
        
      424. 
      
        
    424. 
          
          
          
        
      425. 
      
        
    425. 
          
          
            (
        
      426. 
      
        
    426. 
          
          
              # echo -n "${underline}${yellow}${FUNC_NAME}${reset} "
        
      427. 
      
        
    427. 
          
          
              echo -n "${FUNC_NAME} "
        
      428. 
      
        
    428. 
          
          
              [[ -z "$OPTIONS" ]] || echo -n "${OPTIONS}"
        
      429. 
      
        
    429. 
          
          
              echo -n ": "
        
      430. 
      
        
    430. 
          
          
              cat
        
      431. 
      
        
    431. 
          
          
            ) | fold -sw $WIDTH | sed -E \
        
      432. 
      
        
    432. 
          
          
              -e "1 s/^([[:alpha:]-]+) /\\1 ${green}/" \
        
      433. 
      
        
    433. 
          
          
              -e "1,/:/ s/:/${reset}:/" \
        
      434. 
      
        
    434. 
          
          
              -e "1 s/^([[:alpha:]-]+)/${yellow}${underline}\\1${reset}/" \
        
      435. 
      
        
    435. 
          
          
              -e '2,$s/^/  /'
        
      436. 
      
        
    436. 
          
          
              # We fold, then color because fold sees the control characters as just plain characters, so it throws the fold off.
        
      437. 
      
        
    437. 
          
          
              # The non-printing characters are only really understood as such by the terminal and individual programs that
        
      438. 
      
        
    438. 
          
          
              # support it (which fold should, but, as this is written, doesn't).
        
      439. 
      
        
    439. 
          
          
              # 1 & 2) make options green
        
      440. 
      
        
    440. 
          
          
              # 3) yellow underline function name
        
      441. 
      
        
    441. 
          
          
              # 4) add hanging indent
        
      442. 
      
        
    442. 
          
          
          }
        
      443. 
      
        
    443. 
          
          
          
        
      444. 
      
        
    444. 
          
          
          # Prints and indents the help for each action
        
      445. 
      
        
    445. 
          
          
          _help-actions-list() {
        
      446. 
      
        
    446. 
          
          
            local GROUP="${1}"; shift
        
      447. 
      
        
    447. 
          
          
            local ACTION
        
      448. 
      
        
    448. 
          
          
            for ACTION in "$@"; do
        
      449. 
      
        
    449. 
          
          
              echo
        
      450. 
      
        
    450. 
          
          
              help-$GROUP-$ACTION -i
        
      451. 
      
        
    451. 
          
          
            done
        
      452. 
      
        
    452. 
          
          
          }
        
      453. 
      
        
    453. 
          
          
          
        
      454. 
      
        
    454. 
          
          
          _help-sub-group-list() {
        
      455. 
      
        
    455. 
          
          
            local PREFIX="${1}"
        
      456. 
      
        
    456. 
          
          
            local GROUPS_VAR="${2}"
        
      457. 
      
        
    457. 
          
          
          
        
      458. 
      
        
    458. 
          
          
            if [[ -n "${!GROUPS_VAR}" ]]; then
        
      459. 
      
        
    459. 
          
          
              local SG
        
      460. 
      
        
    460. 
          
          
              echo "$( {  echo -e "\n${bold}Sub-groups${reset}:";
        
      461. 
      
        
    461. 
          
          
                          for SG in ${!GROUPS_VAR}; do
        
      462. 
      
        
    462. 
          
          
                            echo "* $( SUMMARY_ONLY=true; help-${PREFIX}-${SG} )";
        
      463. 
      
        
    463. 
          
          
                          done; } | indent)"
        
      464. 
      
        
    464. 
          
          
            fi
        
      465. 
      
        
    465. 
          
          
          }
        
      466. 
      
        
    466. 
          
          
          
        
      467. 
      
        
    467. 
          
          
          helpActionPrefix() {
        
      468. 
      
        
    468. 
          
          
            if [[ -z "${INDENT:-}" ]]; then
        
      469. 
      
        
    469. 
          
          
              echo -n "liq $1 "
        
      470. 
      
        
    470. 
          
          
            fi
        
      471. 
      
        
    471. 
          
          
          }
        
      472. 
      
        
    472. 
          
          
          
        
      473. 
      
        
    473. 
          
          
          colorerr() {
        
      474. 
      
        
    474. 
          
          
            # TODO: in the case of long output, it would be nice to notice whether we saw
        
      475. 
      
        
    475. 
          
          
            # error or not and tell the user to scroll back and check the logs. e.g., if
        
      476. 
      
        
    476. 
          
          
            # we see an error and then 20+ lines of stuff, then emit advice.
        
      477. 
      
        
    477. 
          
          
            (eval "$@ 2> >(echo -n \"${red}\"; cat -; tput sgr0)")
        
      478. 
      
        
    478. 
          
          
          }
        
      479. 
      
        
    479. 
          
          
          
        
      480. 
      
        
    480. 
          
          
          # TODO: is this better? We switched to it for awhile, but there were problems.
        
      481. 
      
        
    481. 
          
          
          # The reasons for both the initial switch and the switchback are now obscured
        
      482. 
      
        
    482. 
          
          
          # but may have been due to failure of the original code to exit with the
        
      483. 
      
        
    483. 
          
          
          # underling error status from the eval, which has since been fixed. The
        
      484. 
      
        
    484. 
          
          
          # switchback was, in part, because of problems with syncronous calls. Of course,
        
      485. 
      
        
    485. 
          
          
          # it didn't wait as we would like, but it was also causing functional problems
        
      486. 
      
        
    486. 
          
          
          # with... somethnig.
        
      487. 
      
        
    487. 
          
          
          # TODO: We are currently not using colorerrbg anywhere.
        
      488. 
      
        
    488. 
          
          
          colorerrbg() {
        
      489. 
      
        
    489. 
          
          
            (eval "$@" 2>&1>&3|sed 's/^\(.*\)$/'$'\e''[31m\1'$'\e''[m/'>&2)3>&1 &
        
      490. 
      
        
    490. 
          
          
          }
        
      491. 
      
        
    491. 
          
          
          
        
      492. 
      
        
    492. 
          
          
          # Verifies access to github.
        
      493. 
      
        
    493. 
          
          
          check-git-access() {
        
      494. 
      
        
    494. 
          
          
            # if we don't supress the output, then we get noise even when successful
        
      495. 
      
        
    495. 
          
          
            ssh -qT git@github.com 2> /dev/null || if [ $? -ne 1 ]; then
        
      496. 
      
        
    496. 
          
          
              echoerrandexit "Could not connect to github; try to add add your GitHub key like:\nssh-add /example/path/to/key"
        
      497. 
      
        
    497. 
          
          
            fi
        
      498. 
      
        
    498. 
          
          
          }
        
      499. 
      
        
    499. 
          
          
          
        
      500. 
      
        
    500. 
          
          
          change-working-project() {
        
      501. 
      
        
    501. 
          
          
            if [[ -n "$PROJECT" ]]; then
        
      502. 
      
        
    502. 
          
          
              if ! [[ -d "${LIQ_PLAYGROUND}/${PROJECT}" ]]; then
        
      503. 
      
        
    503. 
          
          
                echoerrandexit "No such project '${PROJECT}' found locally."
        
      504. 
      
        
    504. 
          
          
              fi
        
      505. 
      
        
    505. 
          
          
              cd "${LIQ_PLAYGROUND}/${PROJECT}"
        
      506. 
      
        
    506. 
          
          
            fi
        
      507. 
      
        
    507. 
          
          
          }
        
      508. 
      
        
    508. 
          
          
          
        
      509. 
      
        
    509. 
          
          
          findFile() {
        
      510. 
      
        
    510. 
          
          
            local SEARCH_DIR="${1}"
        
      511. 
      
        
    511. 
          
          
            local FILE_NAME="${2}"
        
      512. 
      
        
    512. 
          
          
            local RES_VAR="${3}"
        
      513. 
      
        
    513. 
          
          
            local FOUND_FILE
        
      514. 
      
        
    514. 
          
          
            local START_DIR="$SEARCH_DIR"
        
      515. 
      
        
    515. 
          
          
          
        
      516. 
      
        
    516. 
          
          
            while SEARCH_DIR="$(cd "$SEARCH_DIR"; echo $PWD)" && [[ "${SEARCH_DIR}" != "/" ]]; do
        
      517. 
      
        
    517. 
          
          
              FOUND_FILE=`find -L "$SEARCH_DIR" -maxdepth 1 -mindepth 1 -name "${FILE_NAME}" -type f | grep "${FILE_NAME}" || true`
        
      518. 
      
        
    518. 
          
          
              if [ -z "$FOUND_FILE" ]; then
        
      519. 
      
        
    519. 
          
          
                SEARCH_DIR="$SEARCH_DIR/.."
        
      520. 
      
        
    520. 
          
          
              else
        
      521. 
      
        
    521. 
          
          
                break
        
      522. 
      
        
    522. 
          
          
              fi
        
      523. 
      
        
    523. 
          
          
            done
        
      524. 
      
        
    524. 
          
          
          
        
      525. 
      
        
    525. 
          
          
            if [ -z "$FOUND_FILE" ]; then
        
      526. 
      
        
    526. 
          
          
              echoerr "Could not find '${FILE_NAME}' in '$START_DIR' or any parent directory."
        
      527. 
      
        
    527. 
          
          
              return 1
        
      528. 
      
        
    528. 
          
          
            else
        
      529. 
      
        
    529. 
          
          
              eval $RES_VAR="$FOUND_FILE"
        
      530. 
      
        
    530. 
          
          
            fi
        
      531. 
      
        
    531. 
          
          
          }
        
      532. 
      
        
    532. 
          
          
          
        
      533. 
      
        
    533. 
          
          
          findBase() {
        
      534. 
      
        
    534. 
          
          
            findFile "${PWD}" package.json PACKAGE_FILE
        
      535. 
      
        
    535. 
          
          
            BASE_DIR="$( cd "$( dirname "${PACKAGE_FILE}" )" && pwd )"
        
      536. 
      
        
    536. 
          
          
          }
        
      537. 
      
        
    537. 
          
          
          
        
      538. 
      
        
    538. 
          
          
          sourceFile() {
        
      539. 
      
        
    539. 
          
          
            local SEARCH_DIR="${1}"
        
      540. 
      
        
    540. 
          
          
            local FILE_NAME="${2}"
        
      541. 
      
        
    541. 
          
          
            local PROJFILE
        
      542. 
      
        
    542.
