              # Disabling this by default. It can be enabled by setting this variable.
        
      326. 
      
        
    326. 
          
          
              if [[ -n "${__bp_enable_subshells:-}" ]]; then
        
      327. 
      
        
    327. 
          
          
          
        
      328. 
      
        
    328. 
          
          
                  # Set so debug trap will work be invoked in subshells.
        
      329. 
      
        
    329. 
          
          
                  set -o functrace > /dev/null 2>&1
        
      330. 
      
        
    330. 
          
          
                  shopt -s extdebug > /dev/null 2>&1
        
      331. 
      
        
    331. 
          
          
              fi;
        
      332. 
      
        
    332. 
          
          
          
        
      333. 
      
        
    333. 
          
          
              local existing_prompt_command
        
      334. 
      
        
    334. 
          
          
              # Remove setting our trap install string and sanitize the existing prompt command string
        
      335. 
      
        
    335. 
          
          
              existing_prompt_command="${PROMPT_COMMAND//$__bp_install_string[;$'\n']}" # Edge case of appending to PROMPT_COMMAND
        
      336. 
      
        
    336. 
          
          
              existing_prompt_command="${existing_prompt_command//$__bp_install_string}"
        
      337. 
      
        
    337. 
          
          
              __bp_sanitize_string existing_prompt_command "$existing_prompt_command"
        
      338. 
      
        
    338. 
          
          
          
        
      339. 
      
        
    339. 
          
          
              # Install our hooks in PROMPT_COMMAND to allow our trap to know when we've
        
      340. 
      
        
    340. 
          
          
              # actually entered something.
        
      341. 
      
        
    341. 
          
          
              PROMPT_COMMAND=$'__bp_precmd_invoke_cmd\n'
        
      342. 
      
        
    342. 
          
          
              if [[ -n "$existing_prompt_command" ]]; then
        
      343. 
      
        
    343. 
          
          
                  PROMPT_COMMAND+=${existing_prompt_command}$'\n'
        
      344. 
      
        
    344. 
          
          
              fi;
        
      345. 
      
        
    345. 
          
          
              PROMPT_COMMAND+='__bp_interactive_mode'
        
      346. 
      
        
    346. 
          
          
          
        
      347. 
      
        
    347. 
          
          
              # Add two functions to our arrays for convenience
        
      348. 
      
        
    348. 
          
          
              # of definition.
        
      349. 
      
        
    349. 
          
          
              precmd_functions+=(precmd)
        
      350. 
      
        
    350. 
          
          
              preexec_functions+=(preexec)
        
      351. 
      
        
    351. 
          
          
          
        
      352. 
      
        
    352. 
          
          
              # Invoke our two functions manually that were added to $PROMPT_COMMAND
        
      353. 
      
        
    353. 
          
          
              __bp_precmd_invoke_cmd
        
      354. 
      
        
    354. 
          
          
              __bp_interactive_mode
        
      355. 
      
        
    355. 
          
          
          }
        
      356. 
      
        
    356. 
          
          
          
        
      357. 
      
        
    357. 
          
          
          # Sets an installation string as part of our PROMPT_COMMAND to install
        
      358. 
      
        
    358. 
          
          
          # after our session has started. This allows bash-preexec to be included
        
      359. 
      
        
    359. 
          
          
          # at any point in our bash profile.
        
      360. 
      
        
    360. 
          
          
          __bp_install_after_session_init() {
        
      361. 
      
        
    361. 
          
          
              # bash-preexec needs to modify these variables in order to work correctly
        
      362. 
      
        
    362. 
          
          
              # if it can't, just stop the installation
        
      363. 
      
        
    363. 
          
          
              __bp_require_not_readonly PROMPT_COMMAND HISTCONTROL HISTTIMEFORMAT || return
        
      364. 
      
        
    364. 
          
          
          
        
      365. 
      
        
    365. 
          
          
              local sanitized_prompt_command
        
      366. 
      
        
    366. 
          
          
              __bp_sanitize_string sanitized_prompt_command "$PROMPT_COMMAND"
        
      367. 
      
        
    367. 
          
          
              if [[ -n "$sanitized_prompt_command" ]]; then
        
      368. 
      
        
    368. 
          
          
                  PROMPT_COMMAND=${sanitized_prompt_command}$'\n'
        
      369. 
      
        
    369. 
          
          
              fi;
        
      370. 
      
        
    370. 
          
          
              PROMPT_COMMAND+=${__bp_install_string}
        
      371. 
      
        
    371. 
          
          
          }
        
      372. 
      
        
    372. 
          
          
          
        
      373. 
      
        
    373. 
          
          
          # Run our install so long as we're not delaying it.
        
      374. 
      
        
    374. 
          
          
          if [[ -z "${__bp_delay_install:-}" ]]; then
        
      375. 
      
        
    375. 
          
          
              __bp_install_after_session_init
        
      376. 
      
        
    376. 
          
          
          fi;
        
      377. 
      
        
    377. 
          
          
          __bp_install
        
      378. 
      
        
    378. 
          
          
          EOF
        
      379. 
      
        
    379. 
          
          
          )
        
      380. 
      
        
    380. 
          
          
          
        
      381. 
      
        
    381. 
          
          
          bash --init-file <(echo "${SETUP}") -i
        
      382.

    liq.sh

    96.46 % covered

    4542 relevant lines. 4381 lines covered and 161 lines missed.

          list-add-item() {
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
            local LIST_VAR="${1}"; shift
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
            while (( $# > 0 )); do
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          
          
              local ITEM
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
              ITEM="${1}"; shift
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
              # TODO: enforce no newlines in item
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
          
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
              if [[ -n "$ITEM" ]]; then
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
                if [[ -z "${!LIST_VAR:-}" ]]; then
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
                  eval $LIST_VAR='"$ITEM"'
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
                else
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
                  # echo $LIST_VAR='"${!LIST_VAR}"$'"'"'\n'"'"'"${ITEM}"'
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
                  eval $LIST_VAR='"${!LIST_VAR}"$'"'"'\n'"'"'"${ITEM}"'
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
                fi
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
              fi
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
            done
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
          }

          list-add-uniq() {
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
            local LIST_VAR="${1}"; shift
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
            while (( $# > 0 )); do
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
              local ITEM
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
              ITEM="${1}"; shift
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
              # TODO: enforce no newlines in item
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
              if [[ -z $(list-get-index $LIST_VAR "$ITEM") ]]; then
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
                list-add-item $LIST_VAR "$ITEM"
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
              fi
        
      71.

          # Echos the number of items in the list.
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
          #
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          
          
          # Takes single argument, the list var name.
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
          #
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
          # Example:
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
          # list-add-item A B C
        
      80.

          # list-count MY_LIST # echos '3'
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
          list-count() {
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          
          
            if [[ -z "${!1:-}" ]]; then
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
              echo -n "0"
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          
          
            else
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
              echo -e "${!1}" | wc -l | tr -d '[:space:]'
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
            fi
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
          }

          list-from-csv() {
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
            local LIST_VAR="${1}"
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          
          
            local CSV="${2:-}"
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          
          
          
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          
          
            if [[ -z "$CSV" ]]; then
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          
          
              CSV="${!LIST_VAR}"
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          
          
              unset ${LIST_VAR}
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          
          
            fi
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          
          
          
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          
          
            if [[ -n "$CSV" ]]; then
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          
          
              local ADDR
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          
          
              while IFS=',' read -ra ADDR; do
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          
          
                for i in "${ADDR[@]}"; do
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          
          
                  i="$(echo "$i" | awk '{$1=$1};1')"
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          
          
                  list-add-item "$LIST_VAR" "$i"
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
                done
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
              done <<< "$CSV"
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
            fi
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
          }
